body.p: 1. KJV spelling of Zeboiim in Genesis 10:19, Deuteronomy 29:23, and Hosea 11:8. See Zeboiim.
2. Valley where one of the raiding parties of the Philistines turned toward the border of the wilderness (1Â Sm 13:18). It may be identified with Shuk ed-Dubba.
3. One of the villages outside of Jerusalem where the Benjaminites settled after the exile (Neh 11:34).
